seo.whatIs: What is the Real Net Profit Calculator?
seo.whatIsContent: The Real Net Profit Calculator is an essential tool for e-commerce merchants who want to understand their true profitability. Unlike basic profit calculators, this tool accounts for all hidden costs that eat into your margins: advertising spend from platforms like Facebook, TikTok, and Google Ads, shipping costs, return losses, and other operational expenses. Many merchants look at their sales dashboard and think they're profitable, but when you factor in the real cost of customer acquisition and fulfillment, the picture often changes dramatically.
seo.formulaContent: The formula is: Net Profit = Revenue - (Product Cost + Ad Spend + Shipping Cost + Return Losses + Other Costs). Return Losses are calculated as Revenue × Return Rate. For example, if you have $10,000 in revenue, $4,000 product cost, $2,000 ad spend, $500 shipping, and a 5% return rate, your return losses are $500, making your net profit $3,000 (30% margin). The calculator also shows each cost as a percentage of revenue, helping you identify which expenses are eating most of your profits.
seo.whyNeedContent: The sales number in your Salla or Shopify dashboard can be deceiving. It doesn't show you the real picture. You might see $50,000 in monthly sales and feel successful, but after accounting for product costs (40%), ad spend (25%), shipping (5%), and returns (5%), your actual profit might only be $12,500 or even negative. This calculator helps you: identify your biggest cost drivers, understand if your ad spend is sustainable, calculate the true impact of returns on your bottom line, and make data-driven decisions about pricing and marketing budgets.

marketPriceAnalyzer.title: Market Price Positioning Analyzer
marketPriceAnalyzer.description: Analyze your product price compared to competitors and optimize your pricing strategy
marketPriceAnalyzer.positionDescription: Your price is at {position} of the market range
marketPriceAnalyzer.highPriceWarning: Your price is in the luxury segment. Ensure your product quality and branding justify this premium positioning, as it may impact sales volume.

seo.whatIs: What is the Market Price Positioning Analyzer?
seo.whatIsContent: The Market Price Positioning Analyzer is a strategic pricing tool designed for e-commerce merchants who want to understand where their product stands in the competitive landscape. Instead of guessing whether your price is too high or too low, this tool gives you a data-driven view of your market position. By comparing your price against at least 3 competitors, you get a clear picture of whether you're positioned as a budget, value, premium, or luxury option in your market segment.
seo.formulaContent: The formula is: Price Position = (Your Price - Lowest Price) / (Highest Price - Lowest Price) × 100. This gives you a percentage from 0-100 showing where you fall in the market range. For example, if competitor prices are 50, 80, and 120 SAR, and your price is 90 SAR, your position is (90-50)/(120-50)×100 = 57%, placing you in the Premium category. The tool also calculates market average, identifies how many competitors are above and below you, and provides actionable recommendations.
seo.whyNeedContent: Pricing is both mathematical and psychological. Many merchants set prices based on cost-plus margins without considering market positioning. This tool helps you understand: Are you leaving money on the table by pricing too low? Are you losing sales by pricing too high? Where do you stand against competitors? The analyzer provides specific recommendations - if you're below market average, it suggests price increase opportunities. If you're above average, it warns about potential sales volume impact. Smart pricing isn't just about covering costs; it's about finding the sweet spot where you maximize both sales and margins.

safetyStockCalculator.title: Safety Stock Calculator
safetyStockCalculator.description: Calculate your safety stock level and reorder point to prevent stockouts and maintain continuous sales
safetyStockCalculator.averageDailySalesHint: Average number of units sold per day
safetyStockCalculator.leadTimeDaysHint: Days from order to delivery from supplier
safetyStockCalculator.safetyDaysHint: Extra days of stock to keep as buffer (default: 7)
safetyStockCalculator.criticalWarning: Your stock will run out before new inventory arrives. Place an order immediately to avoid stockout.
safetyStockCalculator.warningMessage: Your stock is getting low. Consider placing an order soon to maintain your safety buffer.
safetyStockCalculator.normalMessage: Your current stock level is healthy. No immediate action required.
safetyStockCalculator.formulaExplanation: Reorder Point = (Daily Sales × Lead Time) + Safety Stock. Safety Stock = Daily Sales × Safety Days.

seo.whatIs: What is the Safety Stock Calculator?
seo.whatIsContent: The Safety Stock Calculator is a vital inventory management tool for e-commerce merchants and retailers. It helps you determine the optimal reorder point and safety stock levels to prevent stockouts while minimizing excess inventory costs. Running out of stock means lost sales, disappointed customers, and wasted advertising spend. This calculator uses proven inventory management formulas to tell you exactly when to reorder and how much buffer stock to maintain.
seo.formulaContent: The calculator uses two key formulas: Safety Stock = Average Daily Sales × Safety Days (buffer period). Reorder Point = (Average Daily Sales × Lead Time) + Safety Stock. For example, if you sell 50 units daily, have a 14-day lead time, and want 7 days of safety buffer: Safety Stock = 50 × 7 = 350 units. Reorder Point = (50 × 14) + 350 = 1,050 units. When your inventory drops to 1,050 units, it's time to place a new order.
seo.whyNeedContent: Stockouts are one of the biggest profit killers in e-commerce. When you run out of stock: you lose immediate sales, your ads keep running but can't convert, customers go to competitors and may never return, and your marketplace rankings drop. On the flip side, overstocking ties up capital and increases storage costs. This calculator helps you find the perfect balance. It's especially critical during peak seasons, promotional campaigns, or when working with suppliers who have long lead times. Smart inventory management can be the difference between a profitable business and a struggling one.

discountImpactSimulator.title: Discount Impact Simulator
discountImpactSimulator.description: Simulate the impact of discounts on your profit margin and calculate how many extra units you need to sell to break even
discountImpactSimulator.productCostHint: Your cost per unit including all expenses
discountImpactSimulator.discountPercentageHint: The discount you plan to offer (0-100%)
discountImpactSimulator.currentMonthlySalesHint: Number of units you currently sell per month
discountImpactSimulator.profitComparisonDescription: Compare profits at different sales volumes
discountImpactSimulator.breakEvenExplanation: You need to sell {units} units (+{increase}) to maintain the same total profit with this discount.

seo.whatIs: What is the Discount Impact Simulator?
seo.whatIsContent: The Discount Impact Simulator is an essential tool for e-commerce merchants and retailers planning promotional campaigns. It helps you understand the true impact of discounts on your profit margins and calculates exactly how many additional units you need to sell to maintain the same total profit. Many merchants offer discounts without realizing how dramatically they affect profitability. A 20% discount doesn't just reduce profit by 20% - it can cut your margin in half or more, requiring significantly higher sales volume to compensate.
seo.formulaContent: The simulator uses several key formulas: Original Margin = (Price - Cost) / Price × 100. Discounted Price = Original Price × (1 - Discount%). Discounted Margin = (Discounted Price - Cost) / Discounted Price × 100. Break-Even Units = Current Sales × (Original Margin / Discounted Margin). For example, if your product costs 60 SAR and sells for 100 SAR (40% margin), a 20% discount drops the price to 80 SAR and margin to 25%. To maintain the same profit, you'd need to sell 60% more units.
seo.whyNeedContent: Discounts are a double-edged sword. While they can boost sales volume, they often destroy profitability if not carefully planned. This simulator helps you: understand the true cost of discounts before offering them, calculate realistic sales targets for promotional campaigns, identify when a discount would result in losses, compare different discount scenarios to find the optimal promotion. It's especially valuable during seasonal sales, clearance events, or when competing on price. Smart merchants use this tool to ensure their promotions actually increase total profit, not just revenue.

reviewInsight.description: Analyze customer reviews and extract pain points and praised features using AI
reviewInsight.painPointsDescription: Recurring issues that customers complain about

seo.howItWorks: How Does the Review Analyzer Work?
seo.howItWorksContent: The analyzer works in three stages: First, it analyzes the sentiment of each review and classifies it as positive, negative, or neutral. Second, it extracts recurring issues from negative reviews and determines their severity (high, medium, low). Third, it extracts praised features from positive reviews. Finally, AI provides actionable recommendations for product improvement and market opportunities.
seo.whatIs: What is the Competitor Review Analyzer?
seo.whatIsContent: The Competitor Review Analyzer is an intelligent tool that uses AI to analyze customer comments and reviews on competitor products. The tool performs sentiment analysis (positive, negative, neutral) and extracts the main pain points that customers complain about, as well as the features they praise. This tool is designed specifically for merchants and e-commerce store owners who want to understand the market before importing a new product or improving their current products.
seo.whyNeed: Why Do You Need This Tool?
seo.whyNeedContent: Before importing any new product, it's essential to understand what customers like and dislike about competing products. This tool saves you hours of manual review reading and gives you a comprehensive summary in minutes. You can use this information to choose the right product, improve product descriptions based on what matters to customers, avoid common problems, and differentiate from competitors by addressing their pain points.

seo.whatIs: What is the Product Catalog Cleaner?
seo.whatIsContent: The Product Catalog Cleaner is an intelligent tool that uses AI to automatically translate and format supplier catalogs. Instead of spending days manually translating and formatting hundreds of products, you can upload your catalog file and get a cleaned, translated version with attractive sales-oriented language in minutes. This tool is designed specifically for merchants who import from China or foreign suppliers and need to translate product data to Arabic professionally.
seo.howItWorks: How Does the Catalog Cleaner Work?
seo.howItWorksContent: The cleaner works in three stages: First, it translates titles and descriptions from English to Arabic in a sales-oriented style (not literal translation). Second, it cleans titles from strange symbols and bad formatting and standardizes the format. Third, it generates SEO keywords for each product to improve search engine visibility. The final result is a file ready to upload directly to your store.
seo.whyNeed: Why Do You Need This Tool?
seo.whyNeedContent: If you import products from foreign suppliers, you know how exhausting it is to manually translate and format product data. Literal translation from Google Translate doesn't work for sales, and poor formatting reduces customer trust. This tool saves you hours of manual work, gives you professional sales-oriented translation, cleans data from symbols and errors, and adds SEO keywords to improve your products' search visibility.

seo.whatIs: What is AI Inventory Forecaster?
seo.whatIsContent: AI Inventory Forecaster is an advanced tool that uses artificial intelligence to analyze your sales data and predict when each product will run out of stock. The tool is designed specifically for merchants and e-commerce store owners in Saudi Arabia and the Gulf region, taking into account local seasons like Ramadan, Eid, and White Friday. Instead of unpleasant surprises with stockouts and sales interruptions, you'll get early alerts and accurate recommendations for quantities to order and when.
seo.howItWorks: How does the Inventory Forecaster work?
seo.howItWorksContent: The forecaster works in four stages: First, it analyzes your sales data for the past months and calculates the average daily sales for each product. Second, it detects sales trends (increasing, stable, decreasing) and adjusts predictions accordingly. Third, it discovers seasonal patterns and predicts demand increases in upcoming seasons. Fourth, it calculates the stockout date for each product and compares it with lead time to identify critical products that need immediate ordering.
seo.whyNeed: Why do you need this tool?
seo.whyNeedContent: Inventory stockout is one of the biggest causes of lost sales in e-commerce. When a popular product runs out, you lose sales and may lose the customer forever. On the other hand, ordering too much freezes capital and increases storage costs. This tool helps you find the perfect balance: know when to order, how much to order, and prepare for seasons in advance. The result: continuous sales without interruption, and efficiently utilized capital.

adSpendAuditor.title: Ad Spend Auditor
adSpendAuditor.description: Analyze your ad campaigns against actual profits and discover wasted budget
adSpendAuditor.uploadAdDescription: Upload CSV or Excel file from Facebook, TikTok, or Google Ads
adSpendAuditor.uploadSalesDescription: Upload sales file from your store (Salla, Zid, Shopify)
adSpendAuditor.profitMarginDescription: Average profit margin for your products (after product cost)
adSpendAuditor.campaignPerformanceDescription: Detailed performance of each campaign with true ROI
adSpendAuditor.recommendationsDescription: Suggested actions to improve your campaign performance

seo.whatIs: What is Ad Spend Auditor?
seo.whatIsContent: Ad Spend Auditor is an intelligent tool that connects your ad spending with your actual profits. Instead of relying only on ROAS (which can be misleading), the tool calculates the true ROI for each campaign after deducting product costs. The tool supports reports from Facebook, TikTok, Google, and Snapchat, and links them with your sales data from Salla, Zid, or Shopify. The result: you know exactly which campaign is making you money and which is losing you money.
seo.howItWorks: How does Ad Spend Auditor work?
seo.howItWorksContent: The auditor works in three stages: First, it reads your ad report and extracts data for each campaign (spend, clicks, conversions). Second, it links campaigns with actual sales from your store and calculates real revenue for each campaign. Third, it calculates true ROI = (Revenue - Spend - Product Cost) / Spend × 100. It also calculates CPA (Cost Per Acquisition) and compares it with your profit margin to identify campaigns that cost you more than they earn.
seo.whyNeed: Why do you need this tool?
seo.whyNeedContent: Many merchants rely on ROAS from ad platforms, but ROAS doesn't account for product costs. A campaign with 3x ROAS could be losing money if your profit margin is only 20%! This tool reveals the truth: how much you actually profit from each campaign, and where you're wasting your budget. Based on the analysis, you get clear recommendations: stop this campaign, increase budget for that one, improve targeting for another. The result: save wasted budget and increase real profits.
seo.formulaContent: True ROI = (Campaign Revenue - Ad Spend - Product Costs) / Ad Spend × 100. The tool analyzes your ad reports and sales data to calculate real profitability for each campaign. It also calculates CPA (Cost Per Acquisition) and compares it with your profit margin to identify campaigns that cost more than they earn.

smartProfitAudit.title: Smart Profit Audit
smartProfitAudit.description: AI-powered sales analysis that classifies expenses and identifies losing products
smartProfitAudit.uploadDescription: Upload a CSV or Excel file from Salla, Zid, or Shopify

seo.whatIs: What is Smart Profit Audit?
seo.whatIsContent: Smart Profit Audit is an intelligent tool that analyzes your sales files and automatically classifies expenses using AI. Instead of manually calculating profits for each order, you upload your sales export file and the tool identifies payment gateway fees, shipping costs, taxes, and refunds. The result: you know exactly how much you're making on each order and which products are losing you money.
seo.howItWorks: How Does Smart Profit Audit Work?
seo.howItWorksContent: The audit works in three stages: First, it parses your sales file and extracts order data (revenue, costs, product info). Second, AI classifies each expense into categories: payment gateway fees (Mada, Visa, Apple Pay, Tabby), shipping costs (Aramex, SMSA, DHL), taxes (VAT), and refunds. Third, it calculates net profit for each order and identifies products that are losing money due to high shipping or payment fees.
seo.whyNeed: Why Do You Need This Tool?
seo.whyNeedContent: Many merchants don't know their true profit per order because they don't account for all costs. A product might seem profitable at first glance, but after deducting payment fees, shipping, and taxes, it could be losing money. This tool reveals the truth: which products are actually profitable, which are losing money, and why. Based on the analysis, you get AI recommendations to improve profitability: adjust pricing, change shipping methods, or discontinue losing products.
seo.formulaContent: Net Profit = Total Revenue - (Payment Gateway Fees + Shipping Costs + Taxes + Refunds + Other Costs). The tool uses AI to automatically classify each expense from your sales file into the appropriate category, then calculates profit per order and identifies losing products.
